instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: I got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.  it has .8v on cpu vcore but not getting any video on lcd or hdmi w/ apple oem adapter.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Had a similar problem with an other MBP. The issue here was a faulty BIOS/SPI Flash IC. You can try to flash a known working BIOS binary.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Probably dead CPU, as all <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards end in same way.

Did you test for USB activity at least?
Known good BIOS is worth to try.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
I don't have a donor board for this guy.  am i replacing the bios chip or just flashing it?

customer just wants data at this point?  if bad cpu should i try to reflow it to get the data?

usb mouse: i get initial red flash, but nothing after that

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
You should test with USB macOS pendrive, with Link LED.
If LED flashes, there is 100% USB activity.
If not, no real reason to search for video; board doesn't really boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: I don't have any pen drives that have led lights, but i connected my owc ssd adapter and has a light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Power LED doesn't confirm USB activity...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: light is flasing with ssd inisde

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: I hope Link LED is flashing, not the Power LED of external SSD adapter.
